description.narrative: Output 3.1 By 2023, the Government of Lesotho has an improved child and gender-sensitive, shock-responsive social protection system., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3:By 2023, all children, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender-responsive social policies for the sustainable and equitable realization of their rights.

participating-org.narrative: FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS
MINISTRY OF LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND CHIEFTAINSHIP

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development
Support to cash transfer delivery by government system (humanitarian context)

title.narrative: Lesotho United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Lesotho Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Decade 1)
Lesotho Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Decade 2)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Lesotho 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1 By 2023, the Government of Lesotho has an improved child and gender-sensitive, shock-responsive social protection system.

description.narrative: The Government of Lesotho strengthened the shock-responsive social protection system through the adopted strategic framework for integration and harmonization of safety nets, an integrated policy framework for early warning and early action, a social protection scalability framework and a NISSA portal and methods for updating household data. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of households receiving humanitarian cash transfers through UNICEF response to COVID-19 [COVIDSitRep]
# of households registered in National Information System for Social Assistance (NISSA) (Compact)

actual.value: 2020:330,254 rural and 7,500 urban areas The number of households is slightly lower than previously reported, as it excludes the households who refused to be included and those found not at home repetitively. Urban household enrollment has commenced, expected to be finalized Q1 of 2021.

title.narrative: # of functional social protection coordination committees at national and sub-national levels
Functional shock-responsive social protection mechanism (scalibility framework, SOPs for data users, data updating methods, integrated framework, etc) in place
Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

actual.value: 2020:The procurement of a high-level technical service provider that will lead strategy development is being finalized
